member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateExcludeArea
member.summary: Masks pixels based on their color or by clipping a range of values. The output of this tool is used as an input to the Color Balance Mosaic Dataset tool to eliminate areas such as clouds and water that can skew the statistics used to color balance multiple images.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateExcludeArea.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The raster or mosaic dataset layer that you want to mask. (In, Required)

The name, location and format for the dataset you are creating. When storing a raster dataset in a geodatabase, do not add a file extension to the name of the raster dataset. When storing your raster dataset to a JPEG file, a JPEG 2000 file, or a geodatabase, you can specify a Compression type and Compression Quality within the Environment Settings. (Out, Required)

Choose the pixel depth of your input raster dataset. 8-bit is the default value; however, raster datasets with a greater bit-depth will need to have the color mask and histogram values scaled accordingly. (In, Required)
Create your mask based on the color of the pixels or by clipping high and low values. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateExcludeArea.in_raster
member.summary: The raster or mosaic dataset layer that you want to mask. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateExcludeArea.out_raster
member.summary: The name, location and format for the dataset you are creating. When storing a raster dataset in a geodatabase, do not add a file extension to the name of the raster dataset. When storing your raster dataset to a JPEG file, a JPEG 2000 file, or a geodatabase, you can specify a Compression type and Compression Quality within the Environment Settings. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateExcludeArea.pixel_type
member.summary: Choose the pixel depth of your input raster dataset. 8-bit is the default value; however, raster datasets with a greater bit-depth will need to have the color mask and histogram values scaled accordingly. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateExcludeArea.generate_method
member.summary: Create your mask based on the color of the pixels or by clipping high and low values. (In, Required)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeMosaicDataset
member.summary: Keeps your mosaic dataset up to date. In addition to syncing data, you can update overviews if the underlying imagery has been changed, generate new overviews and cache, and restore the original configuration of mosaic dataset items. You can also remove paths to source data with this tool. To repair paths, you need to use the Repair Mosaic Dataset Paths tool.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeMosaicDataset.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The mosaic dataset you want to synchronize. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeMosaicDataset.in_mosaic_dataset
member.summary: The mosaic dataset you want to synchronize. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeMosaicDataset.where_clause
member.summary: An SQL expression to select which mosaic dataset items will be synchronized. If an expression is not provided, all dataset items will be updated. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeMosaicDataset.new_items
member.summary: Choose whether to include new items when synchronizing and specify which options to use to update the new items. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeMosaicDataset.sync_only_stale
member.summary: Choose whether to update mosaic dataset items where the underlying raster datasets have been modified due to synchronizing. For example, building pyramids or updating the georeferencing of rasters will affect how the overviews are rendered. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeMosaicDataset.update_cellsize_ranges
member.summary: Choose whether to update the cell size ranges. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeMosaicDataset.update_boundary
member.summary: Choose whether to update the boundary. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeMosaicDataset.update_overviews
member.summary: Choose whether to update any obsolete overviews. The overview becomes obsolete if any underlying rasters have been modified due to synchronizing. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeMosaicDataset.build_pyramids
member.summary: Choose whether to build pyramids for the specified mosaic dataset items. Pyramids can be built for each raster item in the mosaic dataset. Pyramids can improve the speed at which each raster is displayed. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeMosaicDataset.calculate_statistics
member.summary: Choose whether to calculate statistics for the specified mosaic dataset items. Statistics are required for your mosaic dataset when performing certain tasks, such as applying a contrast stretch. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeMosaicDataset.build_thumbnails
member.summary: Choose whether to build thumbnails for the specified mosaic dataset items. Thumbnails are small, highly resampled images that can be created for each raster item in the mosaic definition. Thumbnails can be accessed when the mosaic dataset is accessed as an image service and will display as part of the item description. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeMosaicDataset.build_item_cache
member.summary: Choose whether to build a cache for the specified mosaic dataset items. A cache can be created when you've added data using the LAS, Terrain, or LAS Dataset raster types. Items can also be cached using the Cached Raster function. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeMosaicDataset.rebuild_raster
member.summary: Choose whether to rebuild the raster items from the data source using the original raster type. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Specify which fields should be updated. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SynchronizeMosaicDataset.broken_items
member.summary: Choose whether to remove any broken links. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Calculates the end time of features based on the time values stored in another field.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CalculateEndTime.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The feature class or table for which an End Time Field is calculated based on the Start Time Field specified. (In, Required)

The field containing values that will be used to calculate values for the End Time Field. The Start Time Field and the End Time Field must be of the same type. For example, if the Start Time Field is of type LONG, the End Time Field should be of type LONG as well. (In, Required)
The field that will be populated with values based on the Start Time Field specified. The Start Time Field and the End Time Field must be of the same format. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CalculateEndTime.in_table
member.summary: The feature class or table for which an End Time Field is calculated based on the Start Time Field specified. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CalculateEndTime.start_field
member.summary: The field containing values that will be used to calculate values for the End Time Field. The Start Time Field and the End Time Field must be of the same type. For example, if the Start Time Field is of type LONG, the End Time Field should be of type LONG as well. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CalculateEndTime.end_field
member.summary: The field that will be populated with values based on the Start Time Field specified. The Start Time Field and the End Time Field must be of the same format. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CalculateEndTime.fields
member.summary: The name of the field or fields that can be used to uniquely identify spatial entities. These fields are used to first sort based on entity type if there is more than one entity. For instance, for a feature class representing population values per state over time, the state name could be the unique value field (the entity). If population figures are per county, you would need to set the county name and state name as the unique value fields, since some county names are the same for different states. If there is only one entity, this parameter can be ignored. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Output Table (out, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ConvertTimeField
member.summary: Converts time values stored in a string or numeric field to a date field. The tool can also be used to convert time values stored in string, numeric, or date fields into custom formats such as day of the week and month of the year.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ConvertTimeField.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: in_table
param.summary: The layer or table that contains the field containing the time values that need to be converted. (In, Required)

param.name: input_time_field
param.summary: The field containing the time values. May be of type short, long, float, double, text, or date. (In, Required)

param.name: input_time_format
param.summary:
The format in which the time values were stored in the input time field. Either a standard time format can be selected from the drop-down list or a custom format can be entered.
The format strings are case sensitive.If the data type of the time field is date, no time format is required.If the data type of the time field is numeric (Short, Long, Float, or Double), a list of standard numeric time formats is provided in the drop-down list.If the data type of the time field is string, a list of standard string time formats is provided in the drop-down list. For string fields, you can also choose to specify a custom time format. For example, the time values may have been stored in a string field in one of the standard formats such as yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss or in a custom format such as dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm:ss. For the custom format, you can also specify the a.m., p.m. designator. Some commonly used formats are listed below:yyyy - Year represented by four digits. MM - Month as digits with leading zero for single-digit months.MMM - Month as a three-letter abbreviation. dd - Day of month as digits with leading zero for single-digit days.ddd - Day of week as a three-letter abbreviation.hh - Hours with leading zero for single-digit hours; 12-hour clock.HH - Hours with leading zero for single-digit hours; 24-hour clock.mm - Minutes with leading zero for single-digit minutes.ss - Seconds with leading zero for single-digit seconds.t - One character time marker string, such as A or P.tt - Multicharacter time marker string, such as AM or PM. (In, Required)

param.name: output_time_field
param.summary: The name of the output field in which the converted time values will be stored. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ConvertTimeField.in_table
member.summary: The layer or table that contains the field containing the time values that need to be converted. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ConvertTimeField.input_time_field
member.summary: The field containing the time values. May be of type short, long, float, double, text, or date. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ConvertTimeField.input_time_format
member.summary:
The format in which the time values were stored in the input time field. Either a standard time format can be selected from the drop-down list or a custom format can be entered.
The format strings are case sensitive.If the data type of the time field is date, no time format is required.If the data type of the time field is numeric (Short, Long, Float, or Double), a list of standard numeric time formats is provided in the drop-down list.If the data type of the time field is string, a list of standard string time formats is provided in the drop-down list. For string fields, you can also choose to specify a custom time format. For example, the time values may have been stored in a string field in one of the standard formats such as yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss or in a custom format such as dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm:ss. For the custom format, you can also specify the a.m., p.m. designator. Some commonly used formats are listed below:yyyy - Year represented by four digits. MM - Month as digits with leading zero for single-digit months.MMM - Month as a three-letter abbreviation. dd - Day of month as digits with leading zero for single-digit days.ddd - Day of week as a three-letter abbreviation.hh - Hours with leading zero for single-digit hours; 12-hour clock.HH - Hours with leading zero for single-digit hours; 24-hour clock.mm - Minutes with leading zero for single-digit minutes.ss - Seconds with leading zero for single-digit seconds.t - One character time marker string, such as A or P.tt - Multicharacter time marker string, such as AM or PM. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ConvertTimeField.output_time_field
member.summary: The name of the output field in which the converted time values will be stored. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ConvertTimeField.output_time_type
member.summary: The data type of the output time field. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ConvertTimeField.output_time_format
member.summary:
The format in which the output time values will be saved. The list of output time formats depends on the output data type specified for the output time field. A custom format can also be used when the data type of the output time field is not Date. For a list of custom formats, see the explanation of Input Time Format.
If the data type of the output time field isn't long enough to store the converted time value, the output value will be truncated. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Output Table (out, Optional)

member.summary: Switch data stored in fields or columns to rows in a new table or feature class.

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input feature class or table containing data value fields to be transposed. (In, Required)
The fields or columns containing data values in the input table that need to be transposed. (In, Required)

The output feature class or table. The output will contain a transposed field, a value field, and any number of specified attribute fields that need to be inherited from the input table. (Out, Required)

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The raster that you want to transform. (In, Required)

The name, location, and format for the dataset you are creating. When storing a raster dataset in a geodatabase, do not add a file extension to the name of the raster dataset. When storing your raster dataset to a JPEG file, a JPEG 2000 file, a TIFF file, or a geodatabase, you can specify a compression type and compression quality using environment settings. (Out, Required)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateGeometricNetwork
member.summary: Creates a geometric network in a geodatabase using the specified feature classes, role for each feature class, and the specified weights with weight associations.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateGeometricNetwork.#ctor(System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The feature dataset in which the geometric network will be created. In an enterprise geodatabase, the feature dataset and feature classes that will participate in the geometric network cannot be versioned. (In, Required)
The name of the geometric network to be created. (In, Required)

The input feature classes to be added to the geometric network and the role the feature class should play in the geometric network. Roles can be: SIMPLE_JUNCTIONâ€”The only option for point feature classes. SIMPLE_EDGEâ€”Used for line feature classes and only allows resources to flow from one end of the edge and out the other end. COMPLEX_EDGEâ€”Used for line feature classes and allows resources to be siphoned off along the length of the edge. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateGeometricNetwork.in_feature_dataset
member.summary: The feature dataset in which the geometric network will be created. In an enterprise geodatabase, the feature dataset and feature classes that will participate in the geometric network cannot be versioned. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateGeometricNetwork.out_name
member.summary: The name of the geometric network to be created. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateGeometricNetwork.in_source_feature_classes
member.summary: The input feature classes to be added to the geometric network and the role the feature class should play in the geometric network. Roles can be: SIMPLE_JUNCTIONâ€”The only option for point feature classes. SIMPLE_EDGEâ€”Used for line feature classes and only allows resources to flow from one end of the edge and out the other end. COMPLEX_EDGEâ€”Used for line feature classes and allows resources to be siphoned off along the length of the edge. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateGeometricNetwork.snap_tolerance
member.summary: The snapping tolerance to be set on the geometric network. The larger the value, the more likely vertices will be to snap together. The default value is empty, which means that no snapping will be performed during geometric network creation. The snapping performed during geometric network creation cannot be undone. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateGeometricNetwork.weights
member.summary: Weights are the cost of traveling along an edge in a network. For example, in a water network, a weight can be the length of the pipe. Indicate the weight name, weight type, and for bitgate weights, the size. The type of the weight determines which feature class fields can be associated with the weight. Types can be one of the following: Integerâ€”Can be associated with fields of type Short Integer or Long Integer. Singleâ€”Can be associated with fields of type Float. Doubleâ€”Can be associated with fields of type Float or Double. Bitgateâ€”Can be associated with fields of type Short Integer or Long Integer. Only values from 0 to 31 are supported. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateGeometricNetwork.weight_associations
member.summary: Specifies the weight associations for each field and feature class. When adding a new network weight, it must be associated with a field in a feature class which will provide the values to determine the weight for the features. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateGeometricNetwork.z_snap_tolerance
member.summary: The snapping tolerance to be set on the geometric network with z-coordinate based snapping. The larger the value, the more likely vertices will be to snap together. The default value is empty which means that no snapping will be performed during geometric network creation, and the geometric network will not support Zs. A value of zero indicates that no snapping will be performed during the geometric network creation, but the geometric network will support Zs. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateGeometricNetwork.preserve_enabled_values
member.summary: Specifies whether to preserve the values in any existing enabled fields or whether the values should be reset to their default value of True. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TraceGeometricNetwork
member.summary: Solves the specified network analysis problem based on the flags, barriers, and specified weight properties.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TraceGeometricNetwork.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The geometric network on which the trace will be performed. (In, Required)

param.name: out_network_layer
param.summary: The name of the group layer that will store the results of the trace as a selected set. (Out, Required)

param.name: in_flags
param.summary: Point features representing a set of flags that serve as starting points for the tracing operation. For example, if you are performing an upstream trace, you use a flag to specify where the upstream trace will begin. Flags can be placed anywhere along edges or junctions, but junctions will be considered first when both a junction and edge are found at the location. (In, Required)

member.param: Trace task to be performed on the specified geometric network. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TraceGeometricNetwork.in_geometric_network
member.summary: The geometric network on which the trace will be performed. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TraceGeometricNetwork.out_network_layer
member.summary: The name of the group layer that will store the results of the trace as a selected set. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TraceGeometricNetwork.in_flags
member.summary: Point features representing a set of flags that serve as starting points for the tracing operation. For example, if you are performing an upstream trace, you use a flag to specify where the upstream trace will begin. Flags can be placed anywhere along edges or junctions, but junctions will be considered first when both a junction and edge are found at the location. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TraceGeometricNetwork.in_trace_task_type
member.summary: Trace task to be performed on the specified geometric network. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TraceGeometricNetwork.in_barriers
member.summary: Point features representing a set of barriers. Barriers define places in the network where traces cannot pass through. If you are only interested in tracing a particular part of your network, you can use barriers to isolate that part of the network. Barriers can be placed anywhere along edges or junctions, but junctions will be considered first when both a junction and edge are found at the location. The feature will be treated as disabled and will not be considered during the trace, unless you've set the in_trace_ends parameter to TRACE_ENDS to purposefully find features stopping the trace. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TraceGeometricNetwork.in_junction_weight
member.summary: A junction weight that is used as a cost for traversing through any junction. The weight must already be defined for the given geometric network. This parameter is disabled or ignored when one of the following cost-independent trace task types is specified: (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TraceGeometricNetwork.in_edge_along_digitized_weight
member.summary: An edge weight that is used as a cost for traversing through an edge along the digitized direction of that edge. The weight must already be defined for the given geometric network. This parameter is disabled or ignored when one of the following cost-independent trace task types is specified: (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TraceGeometricNetwork.in_edge_against_digitized_weight
member.summary: An edge weight that is used as a cost for traversing through an edge against the digitized direction of that edge. The weight must already be defined for the given geometric network. This parameter is disabled or ignored when one of the following cost-independent trace task types is specified: (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TraceGeometricNetwork.in_disable_from_trace
member.summary: List of feature classes that are disabled from participating in the trace. Specifying a feature class as disabled makes the trace operation treat all features in that feature class as either being disabled or as having a barrier placed on them. Use this option to exclude an entire feature class from consideration during a trace. For example, by disabling the switches layer in an electrical distribution network, setting the in_trace_ends parameter to TRACE_ENDS and tracing from a given point in the network, you can find the switches that need to be thrown to isolate this point from the network; these will be the features at which the trace operation is stopped. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TraceGeometricNetwork.in_trace_ends
member.summary: Indicates whether the trace should include all features or only those stopping the trace. Use this option when you need to determine which features are stopping a trace. In order to be returned from the trace operation with this option, features must fall into one of the following categories: The feature is connected to only one other geometric network feature (dead ends).The feature is disabled (including those in disabled feature classes).The feature has a barrier placed on it. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TraceGeometricNetwork.in_trace_indeterminate_flow
member.summary: Indicates whether the trace should include all features or only those stopping the trace. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TraceGeometricNetwork.in_junction_weight_filter
member.summary: The weight to use to create the junction weight filter, which is used to filter junction features during the trace. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TraceGeometricNetwork.in_junction_weight_range
member.summary: Specifies valid or invalid ranges of weight values for network features that can be traced. It is disabled when a cost-independent trace task type is set. In order to create a weight filter, you must specify valid weight ranges for the features. A weight filter can be composed of a number of ranges. When you specify multiple weight ranges, delimit the ranges with commas. Low and high values in a range are separated by a hyphen. Ranges consisting of a single value do not contain a hyphen and are delimited with commas, for example, 0-2,3,6,7-10. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TraceGeometricNetwork.in_junction_weight_range_not
member.summary: Applies the logical NOT operator to the specified junction weight ranges. By default, the junction weight ranges that you enter specify junction features that can be traced. By checking this option, you indicate that junction features with weights in the ranges you entered cannot be traced. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TraceGeometricNetwork.in_edge_along_digitized_weight_filter
member.summary: The weight to use to create the along-edge weight filter, which is used to filter edge features during the trace. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TraceGeometricNetwork.in_edge_against_digitized_weight_filter
member.summary: The weight to use to create the against-edge weight filter, which is used to filter edge features during the trace. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TraceGeometricNetwork.in_edge_weight_range
member.summary: Specifies valid or invalid ranges of weight values for network features that can be traced. It is disabled when a cost-independent trace task type is set. In order to create a weight filter, you must specify valid weight ranges for the features. A weight filter can be composed of a number of ranges. When you specify multiple weight ranges, you must delimit the ranges with commas. Low and high values in a range are separated by a hyphen. Ranges consisting of a single value do not contain a hyphen and are delimited with commas, for example, 0-2,3,6,7-10. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.TraceGeometricNetwork.in_edge_weight_range_not
member.summary: Applies the logical NOT operator to the specified edge weight ranges. By default, the edge weight ranges that you enter specify edge features that can be traced. By checking this option, you indicate that edge features with weights in the ranges you entered cannot be traced. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Accumulation Cost (out, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.AddAttachments
member.summary: Adds file attachments to the records of a geodatabase feature class or table. The attachments are stored internally in the geodatabase in a separate attachment table that maintains linkage to the target dataset. Attachments are added to the target dataset using a match table that dictates for each input record (or an attribute group of records) the path to a file to add as an attachment to that record.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.AddAttachments.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: in_dataset
param.summary: Geodatabase table or feature class to add attachments to. Attachments are not added directly to this table, but rather to a related attachment table that maintains linkage to the input dataset. (In, Required)

param.name: in_join_field
param.summary: Field from the Input Dataset that has values that match the values in the Match Join Field. Records that have join field values that match between the Input Dataset and the Match Table will have attachments added. This field can be an Object ID field or any other identifying attribute. (In, Required)

param.name: in_match_table
param.summary: Table that identifies which input records will have attachments added and the paths to those attachments. (In, Required)

param.name: in_match_join_field
param.summary: Field from the match table that indicates which records in the Input Dataset will have specified attachments added. This field can have values that match Input Dataset Object IDs or some other identifying attribute. (In, Required)

param.name: in_match_path_field
param.summary: Field from the match table that contains paths to the attachments to add to Input Dataset records. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.AddAttachments.in_dataset
member.summary: Geodatabase table or feature class to add attachments to. Attachments are not added directly to this table, but rather to a related attachment table that maintains linkage to the input dataset. (In, Required)

member.summary: Field from the match table that indicates which records in the Input Dataset will have specified attachments added. This field can have values that match Input Dataset Object IDs or some other identifying attribute. (In, Required)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RemoveAttachments
member.summary: Removes attachments from geodatabase feature class or table records. Since attachments are not actually stored in the input dataset, no changes will be made to that feature class or table, but rather to the related geodatabase table that stores the attachments and maintains linkage with the input dataset. A match table is used to identify which input records (or attribute groups of records) will have attachments removed.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RemoveAttachments.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: in_dataset
param.summary: Geodatabase table or feature class from which to remove attachments. Attachments are not removed directly from this table, but rather from the related attachment table that stores the attachments. The Input Dataset must be in a version 10 or later geodatabase, and the table must have attachments enabled. (In, Required)

param.name: in_join_field
param.summary: Field from the Input Dataset that has values which match the values in the Match Join Field. Records that have join field values that match between the Input Dataset and the Match Table will have attachments removed. This field can be an Object ID field or any other identifying attribute. (In, Required)

param.name: in_match_table
param.summary: Table that identifies which input records will have attachments removed. (In, Required)

param.name: in_match_join_field
param.summary: Field from the match table that indicates which records in the Input Dataset will have specified attachments removed. This field can have values that match Input Dataset Object IDs or some other identifying attribute. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RemoveAttachments.in_dataset
member.summary: Geodatabase table or feature class from which to remove attachments. Attachments are not removed directly from this table, but rather from the related attachment table that stores the attachments. The Input Dataset must be in a version 10 or later geodatabase, and the table must have attachments enabled. (In, Required)

member.summary: Table that identifies which input records will have attachments removed. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RemoveAttachments.in_match_join_field
member.summary: Field from the match table that indicates which records in the Input Dataset will have specified attachments removed. This field can have values that match Input Dataset Object IDs or some other identifying attribute. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RemoveAttachments.in_match_name_field
member.summary: Field from the match table that has the names of attachments to remove from Input Dataset records. If no name field is specified, all attachments will be removed from each record specified in the Match Join Field. If a name field is specified, but a record has a null or empty value in the name field, all attachments will be removed from that record. This field's values should be the short names of the attachment to remove, not the full paths to the files used to make the original attachments. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Output Dataset (out, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties
member.summary: Defines the defaults for displaying a mosaic dataset and serving it as an image service.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The mosaic dataset whose properties need to be set. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.in_mosaic_dataset
member.summary: The mosaic dataset whose properties need to be set. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.rows_maximum_imagesize
member.summary: The maximum number of rows for the mosaicked image, generated by the mosaic dataset for each request. This can help control how much work your server has to do when clients see your imagery. A higher number will create a larger image, but will also increase the amount of time to process the mosaic dataset. It is possible to set the value too small, and the image may not display. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.columns_maximum_imagesize
member.summary: The maximum number of columns for the mosaicked image, generated by the mosaic dataset for each request. This can help control how much work your server has to do when clients see your imagery. A higher number will create a larger image, but will also increase the amount of time to process the mosaic dataset. It is possible to set the value too small, and the image may not display. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.allowed_compressions
member.summary: Define the method of compression for transmitting the mosaicked image from the computer to the display (or from the server to the client). (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.default_compression_type
member.summary: Set the default compression type. The default compression must be in the allowed_compressions list or already set in the mosaic dataset's Allowed Compression Methods property. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.JPEG_quality
member.summary: The compression quality when using JPEG. Compression quality ranges from 1 to 100. A higher number means better image quality but less compression. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.LERC_Tolerance
member.summary: Limits the per pixel error when using LERC compression. This value is specified in the units of the mosaic dataset. For example, if the error is 10 centimeters and the mosaic dataset is in meters, enter 0.1. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.resampling_type
member.summary: Determines how pixel values will be calculated when the dataset is displayed at small scales. Choose an appropriate technique based on the type of data you have. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.clip_to_footprints
member.summary: Often the raster dataset and its footprint have the same extent. If they differ, you can clip the raster dataset to the footprint. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.footprints_may_contain_nodata
member.summary: Allow for pixels that have NoData values. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.clip_to_boundary
member.summary: Often the mosaic dataset and its boundary have the same extent. If they differ, you can clip the mosaic dataset to the boundary. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.color_correction
member.summary: Enable color correction on the mosaic dataset. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.allowed_mensuration_capabilities
member.summary: Choose which measurements your viewers can perform on the mosaic dataset. The ability to perform vertical measurements is dependent on your imagery and may require a DEM. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.default_mensuration_capabilities
member.summary: Choose the default mensuration capability for this mosaic dataset. The default must be set in the allowed_mensuration_capabilities parameter list or already set in the mosaic dataset's Mensuration Capabilities property. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.allowed_mosaic_methods
member.summary: Define the rules for displaying overlapping imagery. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.default_mosaic_method
member.summary: Choose the default mosaic method for this mosaic dataset. The default must be set in the allowed_mosaic_methods parameter list or already set in the mosaic dataset's Allowed Mosaic Methods property. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.order_field
member.summary: Choose the default field to use when ordering rasters using the ByAttribute mosaic method. The list of fields is defined as those in the attribute table that are of type metadata and are integer. This list can include, but is not limited to:NameMinPSMaxPSLowPSHighPSTagGroupNameProductNameCenterXCenterYZOrderShape_LengthShape_Area (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.order_base
member.summary: Sort the rasters based on their difference from this value in the field selected in the order_field parameter (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.sorting_order
member.summary: Choose whether to sort your rasters in an ascending or descending order. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.mosaic_operator
member.summary: Define rules for resolving overlapping pixels. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.blend_width
member.summary: Set the number of pixels over which to apply the BLEND mosaic_operator. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.view_point_x
member.summary: When using the viewpoint mosaic method, you can horizontally shift the center of the image using this parameter. The units are the same as the spatial reference system. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.view_point_y
member.summary: When using the viewpoint mosaic method, you can vertically shift the center of the image using this parameter. The units are the same as the spatial reference system. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.max_num_per_mosaic
member.summary: Set the maximum number of raster datasets that can be displayed at a given time in a mosaic dataset. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.cell_size_tolerance
member.summary: Consider images of similar spatial resolutions as having the same nominal resolution. For example, with a factor of 0.1, all images with cell sizes within 10 percent of each other will be grouped together for tools and operations that use cell sizes. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.cell_size
member.summary: Set the cell size of the mosaic dataset using an existing raster dataset or specify its width (x) and height (y). If you specify the cell size, you can use a single value for a square cell size, or X and Y values for a rectangular cell size. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.metadata_level
member.summary: Set the level of metadata to expose from the server to a client when publishing the mosaic dataset. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.transmission_fields
member.summary: Limit the fields in the attribute table that clients can view. By default, the list includes:NameMinPSMaxPSLowPSHighPSTagGroupNameProductNameCenterXCenterYZOrderShape_LengthShape_Area (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.use_time

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.SetMosaicDatasetProperties.max_num_of_records_returned

member.param: The LAS dataset to process. (In, Required)

param.summary: The name of the resulting LAS dataset layer. Any backslash or forward slash can be used to denote a group layer. (Out, Required)

member.summary: The LAS dataset to process. (In, Required)

member.summary: The name of the resulting LAS dataset layer. Any backslash or forward slash can be used to denote a group layer. (Out, Required)

member.summary: Allows the filtering of LAS points by classification codes. The range of valid values will depend on the class codes supported by the version of LAS files referenced by the LAS dataset. All class codes will be selected by default. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Specifies the return values to be used for filtering LAS points. When nothing is specified, all returns are used. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.MakeLasDatasetLayer.keypoint
member.summary: Indicates whether data points flagged as model key points, or significant measurements that should not be thinned away, should be enabled for display and analysis.. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.MakeLasDatasetLayer.withheld
member.summary: Indicates whether data points flagged as withheld, which typically represent unwanted noise measurements, should be enabled for display and analysis. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.MakeLasDatasetLayer.surface_constraints

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateEnterpriseGeodatabase
member.summary: Creates a database, storage locations, and a database user to act as the geodatabase administrator and owner of the geodatabase. Functionality varies depending on the database management system used. The tool grants the geodatabase administrator privileges required to create a geodatabase, and then creates a geodatabase in the database.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateEnterpriseGeodatabase.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: database_platform
param.summary: Specify the type of database management system to which you will connect to create a geodatabase. (In, Required)

member.param: For SQL Server, provide the SQL Server instance name. Case-sensitive or binary collation SQL Server instances are not supported. (In, Required)

The path and file name of the keycodes file that was created when ArcGIS Server was authorized. This file is in the \\Program Files\ESRI\License<release#>\sysgen folder on Windows or the /arcgis/server/framework/runtime/.wine/drive_c/Program Files/ESRI/License<release#>/sysgen directory on Linux. If you have not already done so, authorize ArcGIS Server to create this file. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateEnterpriseGeodatabase.database_platform
member.summary: Specify the type of database management system to which you will connect to create a geodatabase. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateEnterpriseGeodatabase.instance_name
member.summary: For SQL Server, provide the SQL Server instance name. Case-sensitive or binary collation SQL Server instances are not supported. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateEnterpriseGeodatabase.database_name
member.summary: This parameter is valid for PostgreSQL and SQL Server. You can type either the name of an existing, preconfigured database or a name for a database that the tool will create. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateEnterpriseGeodatabase.account_authentication
member.summary: Specify the type of authentication to use for the database connection. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateEnterpriseGeodatabase.database_admin
member.summary: If you use database authentication, specify a database administrator user. For Oracle, use the sys user. For PostgreSQL, specify a user that has superuser status. For SQL Server, specify any member of the sysadmin fixed server role. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateEnterpriseGeodatabase.database_admin_password
member.summary: If you use database authentication, type the password for the database administrator. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateEnterpriseGeodatabase.sde_schema
member.summary: This parameter is only relevant to SQL Server and indicates whether the geodatabase will be created in the schema of a user named sde or in the dbo schema in the database. If creating a dbo-schema geodatabase, connect as a user who is dbo in the SQL Server instance. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateEnterpriseGeodatabase.gdb_admin_name
member.summary: If you are using PostgreSQL, this value must be sde. If the sde login role does not exist, this tool creates it and grants it superuser status in the database cluster. If the sde login role exists, this tool will grant it superuser status if it does not already have it. The tool also creates an sde schema in the database and grants usage on the schema to public. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateEnterpriseGeodatabase.gdb_admin_password
member.summary: The password for the geodatabase administrator user. If the geodatabase administrator user already exists in the database management system, the password you provide must match the existing password. If the geodatabase administrator user does not already exist, type a valid database password for the new user. The password must meet the password policy enforced by your database. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateEnterpriseGeodatabase.tablespace_name
member.summary: This parameter is only valid for Oracle and PostgreSQL DBMS types. For Oracle, do one of the following: Provide the name of an existing tablespace. This tablespace will be used as the default tablespace for the geodatabase administrator user.Type a valid name for a new tablespace. The tool will create a 400 MB tablespace in the Oracle default storage location and set it as the geodatabase administrator's default tablespace.Leave the tablespace blank, and the tool will create a 400 MB tablespace named SDE_TBS in the Oracle default storage location. The SDE_TBS tablespace will be set as the geodatabase administrator's default tablespace. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateEnterpriseGeodatabase.authorization_file
member.summary: The path and file name of the keycodes file that was created when ArcGIS Server was authorized. This file is in the \\Program Files\ESRI\License<release#>\sysgen folder on Windows or the /arcgis/server/framework/runtime/.wine/drive_c/Program Files/ESRI/License<release#>/sysgen directory on Linux. If you have not already done so, authorize ArcGIS Server to create this file. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateEnterpriseGeodatabase.out_result
member.summary: Enterprise Geodatabase created. (out, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.FeatureEnvelopeToPolygon
member.summary: Creates a feature class containing polygons, each of which represents the envelope of an input feature.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.FeatureEnvelopeToPolygon.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.summary: The database connection file that contains the data to be queried. (In, Required)

param.name: out_layer_name
param.summary: The output name of the feature layer or table view to be created. (In, Required)

param.name: query
param.summary: The SQL statement that defines the select query to be issued to the database. (In, Required)

member.summary: The database connection file that contains the data to be queried. (In, Required)

member.summary: The output name of the feature layer or table view to be created. (In, Required)

member.summary: The SQL statement that defines the select query to be issued to the database. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.MakeQueryLayer.oid_fields
member.summary: One or more fields from the SELECT statement SELECT list that will generate a dynamic, unique row identifier. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.MakeQueryLayer.shape_type
member.summary: Specifies the shape type of the query layer. Only those records from the result set of the query that match the specified shape type will be used in the output query layer. Tool validation will attempt to set this property based on the first record in the result set. This can be changed before executing the tool if it is not the desired output shape type. This parameter is ignored if the result set of the query does not return a geometry field. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.MakeQueryLayer.srid
member.summary: The spatial reference identifier (SRID) value for queries that return geometry. Only those records from the result set of the query that match the specified SRID value will be used in the output query layer. Tool validation will attempt to set this property based on the first record in the result set. This can be changed before executing the tool if it is not the desired output SRID value. This parameter is ignored if the result set of the query does not return a geometry field. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.MakeQueryLayer.spatial_reference
member.summary: The coordinate system that will be used by the output query layer. Tool validation will attempt to set this property based on the first record in the result set. This can be changed before executing the tool if it is not the desired output coordinate system. This parameter is ignored if the result set of the query does not return a geometry field. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Output Feature Layer (out, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateSpatialType
member.summary: Adds the ST_Geometry SQL type, subtypes, and functions to an Oracle or PostgreSQL database. This allows you to use the ST_Geometry SQL type to store geometries in a database that does not contain a geodatabase. You can also use this tool to upgrade the existing ST_Geometry type, subtypes, and functions in an Oracle or PostgreSQL database.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateSpatialType.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: input_database
param.summary: The input_database is the database connection file (.sde) that connects to the Oracle or PostgreSQL database. You must connect as a database administrator user; in Oracle, you must connect as the sys user. (In, Required)

param.name: sde_user_password
param.summary: The password for the sde database user. If the sde user does not exist in the database, it will be created and will use the password you provide. The password policy of the underlying database will be enforced. If the sde user already exists in the database or database cluster, this password must match the existing password. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateSpatialType.input_database
member.summary: The input_database is the database connection file (.sde) that connects to the Oracle or PostgreSQL database. You must connect as a database administrator user; in Oracle, you must connect as the sys user. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateSpatialType.sde_user_password
member.summary: The password for the sde database user. If the sde user does not exist in the database, it will be created and will use the password you provide. The password policy of the underlying database will be enforced. If the sde user already exists in the database or database cluster, this password must match the existing password. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateSpatialType.tablespace_name
member.summary: For Oracle, you can provide the name for a tablespace to be set as the default tablespace for the sde user. If the tablespace does not already exist, it will be created in the Oracle default storage location. If a tablespace with the specified name already exists, it will be set as the sde user's default. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateSpatialType.st_shape_library_path

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.summary: Input dataset that contains records that will have files attached. (In, Required)

param.name: in_folder
param.summary: Folder that contains files to attach. (In, Required)

param.name: out_match_table
param.summary: Table that will be generated which contains two columns: MATCHID and FILENAME. (Out, Required)

param.summary: The values in this field will match the names of the files in the input folder. The matching behavior will ignore file extensions, which allows multiple files with various file extensions to match with a single record in the input dataset. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateAttachmentMatchTable.in_file_filter
member.summary: This parameter is used to limit the files the tool considers for matching. member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ConsolidateLocator.copy_arcsde_locator
member.summary: Prior to version 10.4, this parameter allowed you to specify whether participating locators (for composite locators only) in an enterprise geodatabase will be copied to the consolidated folder or package. As of version 10.4 by default, all participating locators, including locators in an enterprise geodatabase, will be copied to the consolidated folder or package. As this is an optional parameter, it can simply not be specified. If it is specified, the value will default to COPY_ARCSDE. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The name and location of the output locator package (.gcpk). (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.PackageLocator.copy_arcsde_locator
member.summary: Prior to version 10.4, this parameter allowed you to specify whether participating locators (for composite locators only) in an enterprise geodatabase will be copied to the consolidated folder or package. As of version 10.4 by default, all participating locators, including locators in an enterprise geodatabase, will be copied to the consolidated folder or package. As this is an optional parameter, it can simply not be specified. As of version 10.5, locators in an enterprise geodatabase, cannot be accessed and will not be copied to the consolidated folder or package. Packaging composite locators that reference locators stored in enterprise geodatabases or file geodatabases will fail. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Creates a LAS dataset referencing one or more LAS files and optional surface constraint features.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateLasDataset.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The LAS files and folders containing LAS files that will be referenced by the LAS dataset. This information can be supplied as a string containing all the input data or a list of strings containing specific data elements (for example, "lidar1.las; lidar2.las; folder1; folder2" or ["lidar1.las", "lidar2.las", "folder1", "folder2"]). (In, Required)
The LAS dataset that will be created. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateLasDataset.input
member.summary: The LAS files and folders containing LAS files that will be referenced by the LAS dataset. This information can be supplied as a string containing all the input data or a list of strings containing specific data elements (for example, "lidar1.las; lidar2.las; folder1; folder2" or ["lidar1.las", "lidar2.las", "folder1", "folder2"]). (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateLasDataset.out_las_dataset
member.summary: The LAS dataset that will be created. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateLasDataset.folder_recursion
member.summary: Specifies whether lidar data residing in the subdirectories of an input folder will be added to the LAS dataset. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateLasDataset.in_surface_constraints
member.summary: The features that will be referenced by the LAS dataset when generating a triangulated surface. Each feature will need the following properties defined: (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateLasDataset.spatial_reference
member.summary: The spatial reference of the LAS dataset. If no spatial reference is explicitly assigned, the LAS dataset will use the coordinate system of the first input LAS file. If the input files do not contain any spatial reference information and the Input Coordinate System is not set, then the LAS dataset's coordinate system will be listed as unknown. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateLasDataset.compute_stats
member.summary: Specifies whether statistics for the LAS files will be computed and a spatial index generated for the LAS dataset. The presence of statistics allows the LAS dataset layer's filtering and symbology options to only show LAS attribute values that exist in the LAS files. A .lasx auxiliary file is created for each LAS file. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateLasDataset.relative_paths
member.summary: Specifies whether lidar files and surface constraint features will be referenced by the LAS dataset through relative or absolute paths. Using relative paths may be convenient for cases where the LAS dataset and its associated data will be relocated in the file system using the same relative location to one another. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateLasDataset.create_las_prj
member.summary: Specifies whether .prj files will be created for the LAS files referenced by the LAS dataset. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.LasPointStatsAsRaster
member.summary: Creates a raster whose cell values reflect statistical information about measurements from LAS files referenced by a LAS dataset.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.LasPointStatsAsRaster.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The LAS dataset to process. (In, Required)

The location and name of the output raster. When storing a raster dataset in a geodatabase or in a folder such as an Esri Grid, no file extension should be added to the name of the raster dataset. A file extension can be provided to define the raster's format when storing it in a folder, such as .tif to generate a GeoTIFF or .img to generate an ERDAS IMAGINE format file. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.LasPointStatsAsRaster.in_las_dataset
member.summary: The LAS dataset to process. (In, Required)

member.summary: The location and name of the output raster. When storing a raster dataset in a geodatabase or in a folder such as an Esri Grid, no file extension should be added to the name of the raster dataset. A file extension can be provided to define the raster's format when storing it in a folder, such as .tif to generate a GeoTIFF or .img to generate an ERDAS IMAGINE format file. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.LasPointStatsAsRaster.method
member.summary: The type of statistics collected about the LAS points in each cell of the output raster. (In, Optional)

When connecting to Oracle, you must connect as the sys user. (In, Required)

param.name: user_name
param.summary: Type a name for the new database user. (In, Required)

member.summary: When creating a user in an Oracle database, type the name of the tablespace to be used as the default tablespace for the user. You can specify a preconfigured tablespace, or, if the tablespace does not already exist, it will be created in the Oracle default storage location with its size set to 400 MB. If no tablespace is specified, the user's default tablespace will be set to the Oracle default tablespace. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

member.summary: An SQL expression to select specific raster datasets within the mosaic dataset on which you want the item cache built. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Choose to define the mosaic dataset cache. A Cached Raster function will be inserted to the selected items. If an item already has a Cached Raster function, it will not add another one. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.BuildMosaicDatasetItemCache.generate_cache
member.summary: Choose to generate the cache files based on the properties defined in the Cached Raster function, such as the location and the compression of the cache. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.BuildMosaicDatasetItemCache.item_cache_folder
member.summary: Choose to overwrite the default location to save your cache. If the mosaic dataset is inside of a file geodatabase, by default, the cache is saved in a folder with the same name as the geodatabase and a .cache extension. If the mosaic dataset is inside of an enterprise geodatabase, by default, the cache will be saved inside of that geodatabase. Once created, the cache will always save to the same location. To save the cache to a different location, you need to first use the Repair Mosaic Dataset tool to specify a new location and run this tool again. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.BuildMosaicDatasetItemCache.compression_method
member.summary: Choose how you want to compress your data for faster transmission. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.BuildMosaicDatasetItemCache.compression_quality
member.summary: Set a compression quality when using the lossy method. The compression quality value is between 1 and 100 percent, with 100 compressing the least. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.BuildMosaicDatasetItemCache.max_allowed_rows
member.summary: Limit the size of the cache dataset by number of rows. If value is more than the number of rows in the dataset, the cache will not generate. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.BuildMosaicDatasetItemCache.max_allowed_columns
member.summary: Limit the size of the cache dataset by number of columns. If value is more than the number of columns in the dataset, the cache will not generate. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Reorders, in ascending or descending order, records in a feature class or table based on one or multiple fields. The reordered result is written to a new dataset.

member.summary: Generates tiles from a map or basemap and packages the tiles to create a single compressed .tpk file.

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The map document from which tiles will be generated and packaged. (In, Required)

param.name: service_type
param.summary:
Specifies whether the tiling scheme will be generated from an existing map service or whether map tiles will be generated for ArcGIS Online, Bing Maps, and Google Maps.
(In, Required)

member.param: The output map tile package. (Out, Required)
Specifies the format of the generated tiles. (In, Required)
The maximum scale at which tiles will be generated for the package. The default is 1. Possible values are 1 through 24. (In, Required)

member.summary: The map document from which tiles will be generated and packaged. (In, Required)

member.summary:
Specifies whether the tiling scheme will be generated from an existing map service or whether map tiles will be generated for ArcGIS Online, Bing Maps, and Google Maps.
(In, Required)

member.summary: The output map tile package. (Out, Required)

member.summary: Specifies the format of the generated tiles. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateMapTilePackage.level_of_detail
member.summary: The maximum scale at which tiles will be generated for the package. The default is 1. Possible values are 1 through 24. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateMapTilePackage.service_file
member.summary: The name of the map service or the XML files to use for the tiling scheme. This parameter is required only when the service_type parameter is EXISTING. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Adds summary information to the properties of the package. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Adds tag information to the properties of the package. Multiple tags can be added, separated by a comma or semicolon. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Specifies the extent by manually entering the coordinates in the extent parameter using the format X-Min Y-Min X-Max Y-Max. To use the extent of a specific layer, specify the layer name. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RegisterRaster
member.summary: Automatically aligns a raster to a reference image or uses a control point file for georegistration. If the input dataset is a mosaic dataset, the tool will operate on each mosaic dataset item. To automatically register the image, the input raster and the reference raster must be in a relatively close geographic area. The tool will run faster if the raster datasets are in close alignment. You may need to create a link file, also known as a control point file, with a few links to get your input raster into the same map space.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RegisterRaster.#ctor(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: in_raster
param.summary: The raster that you want to realign. Registering a mosaic dataset item will update that particular item within the mosaic dataset. (In, Required)

param.name: register_mode
param.summary: Choose the registration mode. You can either register the raster with a transformation or reset the transformation. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RegisterRaster.in_raster
member.summary: The raster that you want to realign. Registering a mosaic dataset item will update that particular item within the mosaic dataset. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RegisterRaster.register_mode
member.summary: Choose the registration mode. You can either register the raster with a transformation or reset the transformation. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RegisterRaster.reference_raster
member.summary: Choose the raster dataset that will align the input raster dataset. Leave this parameter empty if you want to register your multispectral mosaic dataset items to their associated panchromatic raster datasets. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RegisterRaster.input_link_file
member.summary: The file that has the coordinates to link the input raster dataset with the reference. The input link table works with one mosaic item in the mosaic layer. The input must specify which item is being processed, either selecting the item or specifying the ObjectID in the input. Leave this parameter empty to register multispectral mosaic dataset items with the associated panchromatic raster datasets. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RegisterRaster.transformation_type
member.summary: The method for shifting the raster dataset. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RegisterRaster.output_cpt_link_file
member.summary: If specified, a text file will be written containing the links created by this tool. This file can be used in the Warp From File tool. The output link table works with one mosaic dataset item in the mosaic layer. The input must specify which item is being processed, either selecting the item or specifying the ObjectID in the input. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RegisterRaster.maximum_rms_value
member.summary: Set the amount of modeled error (in pixels) that you want in the output. The default is 0.5, and values below 0.3 are not recommended as this leads to overfitting. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RegisterRaster.out_raster
member.summary: Output Raster (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RegisterRaster.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RegisterRaster.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RegisterRaster.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RegisterRaster.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RegisterRaster.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateTileCacheTilingScheme
member.summary: Creates a tiling scheme file based on the information from the source dataset. The tiling scheme file will then be used in the Manage Tile Cache tool when creating cache tiles.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateTileCacheTilingScheme.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The source to be used to generate the tiling scheme. It can be a raster dataset, a mosaic dataset, or a map. (In, Required)
The path and file name for the output tiling scheme to be created. (Out, Required)

param.name: tiling_scheme_generation_method
param.summary: Choose to use a new or predefined tiling scheme. You can define a new tiling scheme with this tool or browse to a predefined tiling scheme file (.xml). (In, Required)

member.param: The number of scale levels to be created in the tiling scheme. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateTileCacheTilingScheme.in_dataset
member.summary: The source to be used to generate the tiling scheme. It can be a raster dataset, a mosaic dataset, or a map. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateTileCacheTilingScheme.out_tiling_scheme
member.summary: The path and file name for the output tiling scheme to be created. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateTileCacheTilingScheme.tiling_scheme_generation_method
member.summary: Choose to use a new or predefined tiling scheme. You can define a new tiling scheme with this tool or browse to a predefined tiling scheme file (.xml). (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateTileCacheTilingScheme.number_of_scales
member.summary: The number of scale levels to be created in the tiling scheme. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateTileCacheTilingScheme.predefined_tiling_scheme
member.summary: Path to a predefined tiling scheme file (usually named conf.xml). This parameter is enabled only when the Predefined option is chosen as the tiling scheme generation method. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateTileCacheTilingScheme.scales
member.summary: Scale levels to be included in the tiling scheme. By default, these are not represented as fractions. Instead, use 500 to represent a scale of 1:500, and so on. The value entered in the Number of Scales parameter generates a set of default scale levels. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateTileCacheTilingScheme.scales_type
member.summary: Determines the units of the scales parameter. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateTileCacheTilingScheme.tile_origin
member.summary: The origin (upper left corner) of the tiling scheme in the coordinates of the spatial reference of the source dataset. The extent of the source dataset must be within (but does not need to coincide) this region. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateTileCacheTilingScheme.dpi
member.summary: The dots per inch of the intended output device. If a DPI is chosen that does not match the resolution of the output device, typically a display monitor, the scale of the tile will appear incorrect. The default value is 96. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateTileCacheTilingScheme.tile_size
member.summary: The width and height of the cache tiles in pixels. The default is 256 by 256. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateTileCacheTilingScheme.tile_format
member.summary: The file format for the tiles in the cache. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateTileCacheTilingScheme.tile_compression_quality
member.summary: Enter a value between 1 and 100 for the JPEG or MIXED compression quality. The default value is 75. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateTileCacheTilingScheme.storage_format
member.summary: Determines the storage format of tiles. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GenerateTileCacheTilingScheme.lerc_error
member.summary: Set the maximum tolerance in pixel values when compressing with LERC. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

The mode for managing the cache. (In, Required)

member.summary: The folder in which the cache dataset is created or the path to an existing tile cache. (In, Required)

member.summary: The mode for managing the cache. (In, Required)

member.summary: Name of the cache dataset to be created inside the cache location. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ManageTileCache.scales
member.summary: The scale levels at which you will create or delete tiles when running this tool, depending on the value of the manage_mode parameter. The pixel size is represented based on the spatial reference of the tiling scheme. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Defines an area of interest to constrain where tiles will be created or deleted. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ManageTileCache.max_cell_size
member.summary: The value that defines the visibility of the data source for which the cache will be generated. By default, the value is empty. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ManageTileCache.min_cached_scale
member.summary: The minimum scale at which you want to create tiles. This does not have to be the smallest scale in your tiling scheme. Your minimum cache scale will determine which scales are used when generating cache. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ManageTileCache.max_cached_scale
member.summary: The maximum scale at which you want to create tiles. This does not have to be the largest scale in your tiling scheme. The maximum cache scale will determine which scales are used when generating cache. (In, Optional)
