member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DetectFeatureChanges
member.summary: Finds where the update line features spatially match the base line features and detects spatial changes, attribute changes, or both, as well as no change, and creates an output feature class containing matched update features with information about their changes, unmatched update features, and unmatched base features.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DetectFeatureChanges.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: update_features
param.summary: Line features to compare to the base features. (In, Required)

param.name: base_features
param.summary: Line features to be compared with update features for change detection. (In, Required)

param.name: out_feature_class
param.summary: Output line feature class with change information. The output contains all participating update features (matched and unmatched) and any unmatched base features. (Out, Required)

param.name: search_distance
param.summary: The distance used to search for match candidates. A distance must be specified and it must be greater than zero. You can choose a preferred unit; the default is the feature unit. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DetectFeatureChanges.update_features
member.summary: Line features to compare to the base features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DetectFeatureChanges.base_features
member.summary: Line features to be compared with update features for change detection. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DetectFeatureChanges.out_feature_class
member.summary: Output line feature class with change information. The output contains all participating update features (matched and unmatched) and any unmatched base features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DetectFeatureChanges.search_distance
member.summary: The distance used to search for match candidates. A distance must be specified and it must be greater than zero. You can choose a preferred unit; the default is the feature unit. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DetectFeatureChanges.match_fields
member.summary: Lists of fields from update and base features. If specified, each pair of fields are checked for match candidates to help determine the right match. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DetectFeatureChanges.out_match_table
member.summary: The output table containing complete feature matching information. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DetectFeatureChanges.change_tolerance
member.summary: The distance used to determine if there is a spatial change. All matched update features and base features are checked against this tolerance. If any portions of update or base features fall outside the zone around the matched feature, it is considered a spatial change. A distance can be equal to or greater than zero. The default is 0. When a value greater than zero is specified, the output will include the LEN_PCT and LEN_ABS fields. You can choose a preferred unit; the default is the feature unit. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DetectFeatureChanges.compare_fields
member.summary: Fields to determine if there is an attribute change between matched update and base features. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DetectFeatureChanges.compare_line_direction
member.summary: Specifies whether or not to compare line directions for matched features. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DetectFeatureChanges.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DetectFeatureChanges.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DetectFeatureChanges.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DetectFeatureChanges.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DetectFeatureChanges.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.Project
member.summary: Projects spatial data from one coordinate system to another.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.Project.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The feature class, feature layer, or feature dataset to be projected. (In, Required)
The output dataset to which the results will be written. (Out, Required)
Valid values are a Spatial Reference object, a file with a .prj extension, or a string representation of a coordinate system. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.Project.in_dataset
member.summary: The feature class, feature layer, or feature dataset to be projected. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.Project.out_dataset
member.summary: The output dataset to which the results will be written. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.Project.out_coor_system
member.summary: Valid values are a Spatial Reference object, a file with a .prj extension, or a string representation of a coordinate system. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.Project.transform_method
member.summary: This method can be used for converting data between two geographic coordinate systems or datums. This optional parameter may be required if the input and output coordinate systems have different datum. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.Project.in_coor_system
member.summary: The coordinate system of the input feature class or dataset. When the input has an unknown, or unspecified, coordinate system, you can specify the data's coordinate system without having to modify the input data (which may not be possible if the input is in read-only format). (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.Project.preserve_shape
member.summary: Specifies whether vertices will be added to the output lines or polygons so their projected shape is more accurate. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.Project.max_deviation
member.summary: Determines how far a projected line or polygon can deviate from its exact projected location when preserve_shape="PRESERVE_SHAPE". The default is 100 times the xy tolerance of the spatial reference of the output dataset. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.Project.vertical
member.summary: The option is only enabled when the input and output coordinate systems have a vertical coordinate system, and the input feature class coordinates have z-values. Also, many vertical transformations require additional data files that must be installed on the computer using the ArcGIS Coordinate Systems Data installation package. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateRuntimeContent
member.summary: Consolidates feature layers, basemaps, network datasets, and locators from your map document into a single folder and prepares the folder for use within applications built with ArcGIS Runtime SDKs. This folder can then be provisioned to devices to use with applications that run offline (applications that can run disconnected from ArcGIS Server or ArcGIS Online).

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateRuntimeContent.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input map document (.mxd) that will be consolidated into a single folder. (In, Required)

The output folder that will contain the consolidated data. This folder can then be deployed to mobile devices to be used within ArcGIS Runtime-based applications.
The output folder and its Runtime content is not intended to be used outside of a Runtime application. (Out, Required)

param.name: service_type
param.summary:
Determines whether the tiling scheme will be generated from an existing map service or if map tiles will be generated for ArcGIS Online, Bing Maps, and Google Maps.
(In, Required)

member.param: Specifies the format of the generated tiles. (In, Required)
Specify the number of scale levels at which tiles will be generated for the package. Possible values are 1 through 20. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateRuntimeContent.in_map
member.summary: The input map document (.mxd) that will be consolidated into a single folder. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateRuntimeContent.output_folder
member.summary:
The output folder that will contain the consolidated data. This folder can then be deployed to mobile devices to be used within ArcGIS Runtime-based applications.
The output folder and its Runtime content is not intended to be used outside of a Runtime application. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateRuntimeContent.in_basemap
member.summary: Input basemap layer that will be included in the Runtime content. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateRuntimeContent.in_locator
member.summary: Input locator (.loc) that will be included in the Runtime content. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateRuntimeContent.extent
member.summary: Specifies the extent by manually entering the coordinates in the extent parameter using the format X-Min Y-Min X-Max Y-Max. To use the extent of a specific layer, specify the layer name. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateRuntimeContent.options
member.summary: Options for determining which layers will be included in the Runtime content. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateRuntimeContent.optimize
member.summary: Optimizes the Runtime content by reducing its size for portability to mobile devices. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateRuntimeContent.service_type
member.summary:
Determines whether the tiling scheme will be generated from an existing map service or if map tiles will be generated for ArcGIS Online, Bing Maps, and Google Maps.

member.summary: Specify the number of scale levels at which tiles will be generated for the package. Possible values are 1 through 20. (In, Required)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.RebuildGeometricNetwork
member.summary: Deletes and re-creates the logical network index for the geometric network. If the geometric network is in an enterprise geodatabase and is versioned, the logical network will be rebuilt across all versions of the database. This tool will not change features in the network, no snapping will occur, and no orphan junction features will be created.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GeodeticDensify
member.summary: Creates new features by replacing input feature's segments with densified approximations of geodesic segments. Four type of geodesic segments can be constructed: Geodesic, Great Elliptic, Loxodrome, and Normal Section.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GeodeticDensify.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input line or polygon features. (In, Required)

param.name: out_feature_class
param.summary: The output feature class containing the densified geodesic features. (Out, Required)

param.name: geodetic_type
param.summary: The type of geodetic segment to construct. Geodetic calculations are performed on the ellipsoid associated with the input data's coordinate system. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GeodeticDensify.in_features
member.summary: The input line or polygon features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GeodeticDensify.out_feature_class
member.summary: The output feature class containing the densified geodesic features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GeodeticDensify.geodetic_type
member.summary: The type of geodetic segment to construct. Geodetic calculations are performed on the ellipsoid associated with the input data's coordinate system. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GeodeticDensify.distance
member.summary: The distance between vertices along the output geodesic segment. The default value is 50 kilometers. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DiagnoseVersionTables
member.summary: Identifies inconsistencies in the delta (A and D) tables of a versioned geodatabase.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DiagnoseVersionTables.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: input_database
param.summary: Provide a database connection (.sde file) to the enterprise, workgroup, or desktop geodatabase in which you suspect delta table inconsistencies exist. The connection must be made as the geodatabase administrator. (In, Required)

param.name: out_log
param.summary: The path and name of the output log file. The log file is an ASCII file containing a list of the tables in the specified version that contain orphaned records, as well as information about what connection file, geodatabase version, and tables for which the tool was run. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DiagnoseVersionTables.input_database
member.summary: Provide a database connection (.sde file) to the enterprise, workgroup, or desktop geodatabase in which you suspect delta table inconsistencies exist. The connection must be made as the geodatabase administrator. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DiagnoseVersionTables.out_log
member.summary: The path and name of the output log file. The log file is an ASCII file containing a list of the tables in the specified version that contain orphaned records, as well as information about what connection file, geodatabase version, and tables for which the tool was run. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DiagnoseVersionTables.target_version
member.summary: The geodatabase version to check for inconsistencies in the delta tables. If no version is specified, all versions are processed. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DiagnoseVersionTables.input_tables
member.summary: Specify a single table or provide a text file containing a list of versioned tables whose associated delta tables you want to check for inconsistencies. Use fully-qualified table names in the text file, and place one table name per line. If no file is specified, all tables in the geodatabase are processed. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DiagnoseVersionTables.out_workspace
member.summary: Diagnosed the geodatabase Version Tables. (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DiagnoseVersionTables.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DiagnoseVersionTables.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DiagnoseVersionTables.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DiagnoseVersionTables.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.DiagnoseVersionTables.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ExportTopologyErrors
member.summary: Exports the errors from a geodatabase topology to the target geodatabase. All information associated with the errors and exceptions, such as the features referenced by the error or exception, are exported. Once they are exported, the feature classes can be accessed using any license level of ArcGIS. The feature classes can be used with the Select by Location dialog box or the Select Layer By Location tool and can be shared with other users who do not have access to the topology itself.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ExportTopologyErrors.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The topology from which the errors will be exported. (In, Required)

param.name: out_path
param.summary: The output workspace to which the feature classes will be created. The default is the workspace where the topology is located. (In, Required)

member.param: Name to prepend to each output feature class. This allows you to specify unique output names when running multiple exports to the same workspace. The default is the topology name. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ExportTopologyErrors.in_topology
member.summary: The topology from which the errors will be exported. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ExportTopologyErrors.out_path
member.summary: The output workspace to which the feature classes will be created. The default is the workspace where the topology is located. (In, Required)

member.summary: Name to prepend to each output feature class. This allows you to specify unique output names when running multiple exports to the same workspace. The default is the topology name. (In, Required)

member.param: The output feature class containing the fishnet of rectangular cells. (Out, Required)
The starting pivot point of the fishnet. (In, Required)
The Y-axis coordinate is used to orient the fishnet. The fishnet is rotated by the same angle as defined by the line connecting the origin and the y-axis coordinate. (In, Required)

Determines the width of each cell. If you want the width to be automatically calculated using the value in the Number of Rows parameter, leave this parameter empty or set the value to zeroâ€”the width will be calculated when the tool is run. (In, Required)

Determines the height of each cell. If you want the height to be automatically calculated using the value in the Number of Columns parameter, leave this parameter empty or set the value to zeroâ€”the height will be calculated when the tool is run. (In, Required)

Determines the number of rows the fishnet will have. If you want the number of rows to be automatically calculated using the value in the Cell Size Width parameter, leave this parameter empty or set the value to zeroâ€”the number of rows will be calculated when the tool is run. (In, Required)

Determines the number of columns the fishnet will have. If you want the number of columns to be automatically calculated using the value in the Cell Size Height parameter, leave this parameter empty or set the value to zeroâ€”the number of columns will be calculated when the tool is run. (In, Required)

member.summary: The output feature class containing the fishnet of rectangular cells. (Out, Required)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateRandomPoints
member.summary: Creates a specified number of random point features. Random points can be generated in an extent window, inside polygon features, on point features, or along line features.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateRandomPoints.#ctor(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The location or workspace in which the random points feature class will be created. This location or workspace must already exist. (In, Required)
The name of the random points feature class to be created. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateRandomPoints.out_path
member.summary: The location or workspace in which the random points feature class will be created. This location or workspace must already exist. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateRandomPoints.out_name
member.summary: The name of the random points feature class to be created. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateRandomPoints.constraining_feature_class
member.summary: Random points will be generated inside or along the features in this feature class. The constraining feature class can be point, multipoint, line, or polygon. Points will be randomly placed inside polygon features, along line features, or at point feature locations. Each feature in this feature class will have the specified number of points generated inside it (for example, if you specify 100 points, and the constraining feature class has 5 features, 100 random points will be generated in each feature, totaling 500 points). (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateRandomPoints.constraining_extent
member.summary: Random points will be generated inside the extent. The constraining extent will only be used if no constraining feature class is specified. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateRandomPoints.number_of_points_or_field
member.summary: The number of points to be randomly generated. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateRandomPoints.minimum_allowed_distance
member.summary: The shortest distance allowed between any two randomly placed points. If a value of 1 Meter is specified, all random points will be farther than 1 meter away from the closest point. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateRandomPoints.create_multipoint_output
member.summary: Determines if the output feature class will be a multipart or single-part feature. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateRandomPoints.multipoint_size
member.summary: If create_multipoint_output is set to MULTIPOINT, specify the number of random points to be placed in each multipoint geometry. The default is 10. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Output Feature Class (out, Optional)

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.summary: The output solution table containing the adjustments. (Out, Required)

member.summary: The type of transformation that will be used when adjusting the mosaic dataset. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeBlockAdjustment.maximum_residual_value
member.summary: A threshold that is used in block adjustment computation; points with residuals exceeding the threshold will not be used. If the transformation is RPC, the proper threshold for eliminating invalid points will be automatically determined. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Specifies the geometric accuracy level of the images. (In, Optional)

member.summary: An output table used to store adjustment quality information. (Out, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeCameraModel
member.summary: Estimates the exterior camera model and interior camera model from the EXIF header of the raw image and refines the camera models. The model is then applied to the mosaic dataset with an option to use a tool-generated, high-resolution digital surface model (DSM) to achieve better orthorectification.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeCameraModel.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: in_mosaic_dataset
param.summary: The mosaic dataset on which to build and calculate the camera model. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeCameraModel.in_mosaic_dataset
member.summary: The mosaic dataset on which to build and calculate the camera model. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeCameraModel.out_dsm
member.summary: A digital surface model raster dataset generated from the adjusted images in the mosaic dataset. If apply_adjustment is set to APPLY, this DSM will be used to replace the DEM in the geometric function to achieve better orthorectification. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeCameraModel.gps_accuracy
member.summary: The accuracy level of your input images. The tool will search for images in the neighborhood to compute matching points and automatically apply an adjustment strategy based on the accuracy level. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeCameraModel.estimate
member.summary: Estimates the camera model by computing the adjustment based on eight times the mosaic dataset's source resolution. Computing adjustment at such levels will be faster but less accurate. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeCameraModel.refine
member.summary: Computes the adjustment at the mosaic dataset resolution. Computing adjustment at this level will provide the most accurate result. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeCameraModel.apply_adjustment
member.summary: Choose whether to apply the adjusted transformation to the mosaic dataset. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeCameraModel.maximum_residual
member.summary: The maximum residual value allowed to keep a computed control point as a valid control point. The default is 5. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeCameraModel.initial_tiepoint_resolution
member.summary: Defines the resolution factor at which tie points are generated when estimating the camera model. The default value is 8, which means eight times the source pixel resolution. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeCameraModel.out_control_points
member.summary: The optional control points feature class. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeCameraModel.out_solution_table
member.summary: The optional adjustment solution table. The solution table contains the Root Mean Square (RMS) of the adjustment error and solution matrix. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeCameraModel.out_solution_point_table
member.summary: The optional solution point feature class. The solution points are the final controls points used to generate the adjustment solution. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeCameraModel.out_flight_path
member.summary: The optional flight path line feature class. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeCameraModel.maximum_overlap

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.BuildStereoModel
member.summary: Builds a stereo model of a mosaic dataset based on a user-provided stereo pair.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.BuildStereoModel.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: in_mosaic_dataset
param.summary: The mosaic dataset on which to build the stereo model. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.BuildStereoModel.in_mosaic_dataset
member.summary: The mosaic dataset on which to build the stereo model. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.BuildStereoModel.minimum_angle
member.summary: The value, in degrees, that defines the minimum angle the stereo pair must meet. The default is 10. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.BuildStereoModel.maximum_angle
member.summary: The value, in degrees, that defines the maximum angle the stereo pair must meet. The default is 70. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.BuildStereoModel.minimum_overlap
member.summary: The percentage of the overlapping area over the whole image. The default is 0.5. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.BuildStereoModel.maximum_diff_OP
member.summary: The maximum threshold for the Omega/Phi difference between the two image pairs. The Omega values and Phi values for the image pairs are compared. If the difference between either the two Omega or the two Phi values is above the threshold, the pairs will not be formatted as a stereo pair. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.BuildStereoModel.maximum_diff_GSD
member.summary: The threshold for the maximum ground sample distance (GSD) between two images in a pair. If the resolution ratio between the two images is greater than the threshold value, the pairs will not be built as a stereo pair. The default is 2. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.BuildStereoModel.group_by
member.summary: Builds the stereo model from raster items within the same group, defined by a mosaic dataset field such as RGB, Panchromatic, or Infrared. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.BuildStereoModel.out_mosaic_dataset
member.summary: Output Mosaic Dataset (out, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GeneratePointCloud
member.summary: Computes 3D points from stereo pairs and outputs a point cloud as a set of LAS files.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GeneratePointCloud.#ctor(System.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: in_mosaic_dataset
param.summary: The input mosaic dataset, which must have completed the block adjustment process and have a stereo model. (In, Required)

member.param: The method used to generate 3D points. (In, Required)
The folder used to store the output LAS files. (Out, Required)
A string used as a prefix to formulate the output LAS file names. For example, if name is used as the base, the output files will be named name1.las, name2.las, and so on. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GeneratePointCloud.in_mosaic_dataset
member.summary: The input mosaic dataset, which must have completed the block adjustment process and have a stereo model. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GeneratePointCloud.matching_method
member.summary: The method used to generate 3D points. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GeneratePointCloud.out_folder
member.summary: The folder used to store the output LAS files. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GeneratePointCloud.out_base_name
member.summary: A string used as a prefix to formulate the output LAS file names. For example, if name is used as the base, the output files will be named name1.las, name2.las, and so on. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GeneratePointCloud.object_size
member.summary: A search radius within which surface objects, such as buildings or trees, will be identified. It is the linear size in map units. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GeneratePointCloud.ground_spacing
member.summary: The ground spacing, in meters, at which the 3D points are generated. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GeneratePointCloud.minimum_pairs
member.summary: The number of pairs used to generate 3D points. The default value is a minimum of 2 image pairs. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GeneratePointCloud.minimum_area
member.summary: Specify a minimum overlap threshold area that is acceptable, which is a percentage of overlap between a pair of images. Image pairs with overlap areas smaller than this threshold will receive a score of 0 for this criteria and will descend in the ordered list. The range of values for the threshold is from 0 to 1. The default threshold value is 0.6, which is equal to 60 percent. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GeneratePointCloud.minimum_adjustment_quality
member.summary: Specify the minimum adjustment quality that is acceptable. The threshold value will be compared to the adjustment quality value that is stored in the stereo model. Image pairs with an adjustment quality less than the specified threshold will receive a score of 0 for this criteria and will descend in the ordered list. The range of values for the threshold is from 0 to 1. The default value is 0.2, which is equal to 20 percent. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GeneratePointCloud.maximum_diff_gsd
member.summary: Specify the maximum allowable threshold for the ground sample distance (GSD) between two images in a pair. The resolution ratio between the two images will be compared to the threshold value. Image pairs with a ground sample ratio greater than this threshold will receive a score of 0 for this criteria and will descend in the ordered list. The default threshold ratio is 2. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.GeneratePointCloud.maximum_diff_OP
member.summary: Specify the maximum threshold for the Omega\Phi difference between the two image pairs. The Omega values and Phi values for the image pairs are compared. Image pairs with an Omega or a Phi difference greater than this threshold will receive a score of 0 for this criteria and will descend in the ordered list. The default threshold difference for each comparison is 8. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeMosaicCandidates
member.summary: Finds the image candidates within in the mosaic dataset that best represents the mosaic area.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeMosaicCandidates.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input mosaic dataset with densely overlapped images. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeMosaicCandidates.in_mosaic_dataset
member.summary: The input mosaic dataset with densely overlapped images. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeMosaicCandidates.maximum_overlap
member.summary: The maximum amount of overlap that you want between the mosaic dataset and the footprint of each image in the mosaic dataset. If the percentage of overlap is higher than this threshold, the image is excluded since it will have too much redundant information. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeMosaicCandidates.maximum_area_loss
member.summary: This is the maximum percentage of area that can be excluded by the candidate images. After the tool chooses the best candidate images based on the maximum_overlap, it will then check to see if the maximum excluded area is below the threshold specified. If the excluded area is greater than the specified threshold, the tool will add more candidate images to fill in some of the voids that were missing. Most of these excluded areas will likely be along the border of the mosaic dataset. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.ComputeMosaicCandidates.out_mosaic_dataset
member.summary: Output Mosaic Dataset (out, Optional)

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateCloudStorageConnectionFile
member.summary: Creates a connection file for ArcGIS-supported cloud storage. It allows existing raster geoprocessing tools to write cloud raster format (CRF) datasets into the cloud storage bucket or read raster datasets (not limited to CRF) stored in the cloud storage as input.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateCloudStorageConnectionFile.#ctor(System.Object,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: out_folder_path
param.summary: The folder path where the connection file will be created. (In, Required)

param.name: out_name
param.summary: The name of the cloud storage connection file. (In, Required)

member.param: Specifies the cloud storage service provider. (In, Required)

param.name: bucket_name
param.summary: The name of the cloud storage container where the raster dataset will be stored. For many cloud providers, it is also called a bucket. (In, Required)

member.summary: The folder path where the connection file will be created. (In, Required)

member.summary: The name of the cloud storage connection file. (In, Required)

member.summary: Specifies the cloud storage service provider. (In, Required)

member.summary: The name of the cloud storage container where the raster dataset will be stored. For many cloud providers, it is also called a bucket. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateCloudStorageConnectionFile.access_key_id
member.summary: The access key ID string for the specific cloud storage type. It can also be the account name as is the case with Azure. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateCloudStorageConnectionFile.secret_access_key
member.summary: The secret access key string to authenticate the connection to cloud storage. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateCloudStorageConnectionFile.region
member.summary: The region string for the cloud storage. If provided, the value must use the format defined by the cloud storage choice. The default is the selected cloud provider's account default. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateCloudStorageConnectionFile.end_point
member.summary: The service endpoint (uris) of the cloud storage, such as oss-us-west-1.aliyuncs.com. If the parameter is not provided, the default endpoint for the selected cloud storage type will be used. The CNAME redirected endpoint can be used if needed. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.DataManagementTools.CreateCloudStorageConnectionFile.config_options
member.summary: Specifies configuration options pertaining to the specific type of cloud service. Some services offer options, some do not. You only need to set the option if you want to turn them on. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Output Connection File (out, Optional)

member.summary: Specify a folder in the cloud storage Bucket (Container) Name where the raster dataset will be stored. (In, Optional)
